page.title: 18INTERVIEW _ OWNER OF MANOR
page.content: {Mr.Grant-Williams}is a Harley Street surgeon and has been the owner of Pertenhall Manor for the last twelve years,although he has always resided in the area.The family trust of Mrs.Grant-Williams bought the Manor which was in a state of disrepair,and preserved it from being converted into an Italian Restaurant. Mains drainage & water were installed six years ago;previously all water came from a well,fed by a natural spring which passes under the house. Large water storage tanks still exist and it is possible to pump 600 gallons a day from this spring. There are 24 rooms including 9 bedrooms, 5 bathrooms and 4 toilets. Mr.Grant-Williams favourite was the dining_room. During restoration,old bills were found pricing the panelling at Â£1500 in 1605.
